message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about how temperature affects plants. When plants are chilled in evening air, it is helpful to put them in a glass building to protect them from further chilling. Option (A) is not a suitable solution because it would damage the plants. Option (B) and (C) are not practical options and would not provide the necessary protection from the cold. Option (D) allows the plants to be placed in a controlled environment where they can be shielded from the chilling effects of the evening air.

This question requires basic knowledge about the needs of plants. When plants are exposed to chilly evening air, they can be protected by placing them in a glass building or greenhouse. This will provide them with a warmer and more stable environment, helping to prevent damage from cold temperatures. Option (A) is incorrect because putting the plants in a fire pit would be dangerous and likely result in their destruction. Option (B) is not a practical solution and does not provide warmth or protection. Option (C) may provide some insulation, but an igloo is not designed for plants and may not provide adequate warmth. Option (D) is the best choice as it offers a controlled environment.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the effects of temperature on plants. When plants are exposed to chilly evening air, it can be detrimental to their growth and survival. Option (D) suggests that putting the plants in a glass building can help protect them from the cold by creating a warmer and more controlled environment. Options (A), (B), and (C) are not logical or practical solutions for protecting plants from cold temperatures.
